physical_appearance:This brocade stole is predominantly brown in colour. Dark brown tassels are attached to the stole on the borders of its height. At the centre of the brocade stole
 there is a vertical crease running down to the bottom. Alternating figures of Krishna and Radha
 Hindu deities
 are present at the borders of its height. The brocade stole does not appear to be torn or frayed.

sgcool_label_text:This tinsel brocade would have been woven in Benaras. It is a silk-gauze popularised by women in the Mughal courts. The border of this brocade is highly unusual and rare for a Benarasi brocade. Alternating figures of Krishna and Radha appear on the wide border
 without any of the usual accompaniments of floral scrollwork
 background patterning
 geometric edging or birds and animals.

metadata.physical_appearance: This brocade stole is predominantly brown in colour. Dark brown tassels are attached to the stole on the borders of its height. At the centre of the brocade stole, there is a vertical crease running down to the bottom. Alternating figures of Krishna and Radha, Hindu deities, are present at the borders of its height. The brocade stole does not appear to be torn or frayed.

metadata.sgcool_label_text: This tinsel brocade would have been woven in Benaras. It is a silk-gauze popularised by women in the Mughal courts. The border of this brocade is highly unusual and rare for a Benarasi brocade. Alternating figures of Krishna and Radha appear on the wide border, without any of the usual accompaniments of floral scrollwork, background patterning, geometric edging or birds and animals.
